title: AI Product Engineer – Pyq AI (YC W23)
summary: Drove Pyq AI's transition from enterprise sales to Product-Led Growth by designing the pre-launch strategy for Mulligan, an integrated insurance automation platform. Pyq has raised $1.4M and automates the back offices of insurance brokerages.
impact: Cut live demo latency 10x (150s → 15s) for PLG launch of Mulligan
Saved clients ≈ $1M annually by automating ~90% of brokerage back offices
Reduced quote time from 1 hr to <10 min with Docker-containerized RPA

title: Software Engineering Intern – Learning Economy Foundation
summary: Built an AI-powered credential generation tool called 'Boost Automation' that automated the creation of digital credentials using OpenAI's GPT and DALL-E 3 APIs.
impact: Designed and implemented AI Boost Wizard with React and Tailwind CSS
Integrated OpenAI function calling to auto-generate structured credential fields
Built DALL-E 3 integration for automatic logo generation
Reduced credential creation time from manual entry to automated AI generation

title: Data Engineering Intern – Inabia Software & Consulting
summary: Enabled pharmaceutical clients to ensure data integrity for compliance audits and boost processing efficiency by 20% by building ETL pipelines to ingest/normalize 1 TB of sensitive health data.
impact: Improved regulator trust by developing NLP models to flag problematic advertising
Enhanced classification accuracy by 15-20% across 500K inquiries
Reduced miscommunication liability for health-care organizations

title: Brain Tumor Classifier
summary: Interactive deep learning system with explainable AI for classifying brain tumors across 4 categories using dual CNN and Xception models.
impact: Dual model architecture: CNN vs Xception
Streamlit web app with real-time predictions

title: Twitter Clone Web Application
summary: Full-stack Twitter prototype supporting 1M+ posts with optimized schema design, deployed on AWS with Docker, Nginx & Gunicorn.
impact: Deployed on AWS with load balancer

title: Coronavirus Twitter Analysis
summary: Analyzed 1.1B tweets in 10+ languages across 20+ countries, creating 4 critical visualizations highlighting global cultural and linguistic differences.
